summary: Actionable checklist for implementing retention editing strategies from scripting through publication.

core_principles.description: Checklist ensures retention engineering is applied consistently
Retention optimization spans scripting, editing, audio, and visual phases
Success measured through retention analytics and viewer behavior
Checklist evolves based on performance analysis and algorithm updates

techniques.name: Scripting Phase Retention Checklist
techniques.description: Pre-production items that enable effective retention editing

items.action: Use AV script format separating audio and visual columns
items.verification: Visual directives exist for every section

items.action: Front-load hook in first 30 seconds
items.verification: Hook clearly defined in script

items.action: Create open loops and curiosity gaps
items.verification: Loops identified and closure points marked

items.action: Include specific B-roll shot descriptions with angles and timing
items.verification: B-roll noted throughout script, not just 'insert B-roll'

items.action: Add motion design prompts for kinetic typography and data viz
items.verification: Text animations specified in visual column

items.action: Mark pacing notes (cuts, speed, pauses
items.verification: Punctuation and script markers guide editor

items.action: Plan visual change points every 3-5 seconds
items.verification: Visual cadence mapped through content

techniques.name: Visual Editing Retention Checklist
techniques.description: Core editing items for maximizing viewer attention

items.action: Visual state changes every 3-5 seconds (cuts, zooms, overlays, B-roll
items.verification: Timeline markers show visual changes throughout

items.action: Apply dynamic zoom or movement to all static shots
items.verification: No tripod-locked static shots without motion

items.action: Use kinetic typography synced to speech
items.verification: Text appears frame-accurate with spoken words

items.action: Insert B-roll every 10-20 seconds during dialogue
items.verification: Talking head sections intercut with B-roll

items.action: Apply pattern interrupts during dense content
items.verification: Context switches or visual breaks every 45-60s

items.action: Remove all fluff, dead air, and unnecessary pauses
items.verification: Timeline gaps eliminated or repurposed for effect

items.action: Hook delivered visually within first 8 seconds
items.verification: First frame is visually compelling, not generic

items.action: Title promise fulfilled visually in first 30 seconds
items.verification: Content early matches what title promised

techniques.name: Audio Design Retention Checklist
techniques.description: Audio engineering items that drive engagement

items.action: Dialogue is clear, crisp, and sits at −14 to −16 LUFS
items.verification: Dialogue not buried in mix

items.action: Music ducked automatically or automatically during speech
items.verification: Music doesn't compete with voice

items.action: SFX timed to visual actions (whooshes, pops, clicks
items.verification: Sound effects sync to transitions and emphasis

items.action: Use music strategically (drops on emphasis, swells on buildups
items.verification: Music serves narrative, not just background

items.action: Include silence for emphasis (1-3 second drops
items.verification: Strategic silence used, not continuous sound

items.action: Layer ambient sounds to prevent audio emptiness
items.verification: Room tone or environmental sounds present

items.action: Manage dynamic range - avoid ear fatigue
items.verification: Quiet and loud moments balanced

items.action: Review retention graph 24-48 hours after publish
items.verification: Analytics dashboard checked within timeframe

items.action: Identify major dip points and analyze causes
items.verification: Dip causes documented (boring section, long pause, confusing graph

items.action: Note retention spikes and investigate value
items.verification: Spike segments analyzed for repurposing

items.action: Check CTR in search and suggested feeds
items.verification: CTR metrics meet or exceed targets (5-7%

items.action: A/B test title and thumbnail on underperforming videos
items.verification: Test variations created and monitored

items.action: Update script templates based on findings
items.verification: Lessons documented for future videos

items.action: Adjust pacing strategy based on retention patterns
items.verification: Next video pacing modified based on data

priority_weighting.high: Critical for retention, must complete every time
priority_weighting.medium: Important for retention, complete when possible
priority_weighting.low: Enhancement items, complete as time allows
